definition: to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently

sentences.english: Shocking, half known arms thrown around dreams.
sentences.chinese: 惊异的，半知晓的手臂涌现梦海。

sentences.english: Abundant church-creation is a blessing and a curse for the house-church movement, too.
sentences.chinese: 对于家庭教会来说，大量组织涌现是祝福也是诅咒。

sentences.english: From deep inside a bull- headed resolution welled up.
sentences.chinese: 一个固执的决定从内心深处涌现出来。

sentences.english: The runup in business school applications during the recession has created a windfall for essay writers.
sentences.chinese: 衰退期间涌现的商学院申请令论文写手大发横财。

sentences.english: A old song kept obtruding upon my consciousness .
sentences.chinese: 一首古老的歌不断在我的意识中涌现。
另一方面，在这份榜单上涌现出226名后起之秀。

sentences.english: Why is it that so often it's when we're in the middle of altercations that these sentiments come out?
sentences.chinese: 为什么常常是在争吵中，这些情感才涌现出来呢？

sentences.english: Zoning after a pet has died or has been dismissed can cause an "Internal Pet Error".
sentences.chinese: 通过小退，玩家可以让他们的宠物在骑乘时涌现。
全新的邻里街坊涌现出来。

sentences.english: Where the darkness is thickest, there the bright beaming light that never is set is about to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 黑暗最浓重的时候，却是光明即将涌现了。

sentences.english: Instead, they are emergent properties of the fundamental laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它们是物理基本定律的涌现性。

sentences.english: Advanced figures are emerging in multitude in this era of ours.
sentences.chinese: 在我们这个时代先进人物正在大量地涌现出来。

sentences.english: The feelings emerge in the process of the poem, both in writing it and reading it.
sentences.chinese: 情感在整个诗歌过程都会涌现，无论是写诗还是读诗。

sentences.english: Recent years have seen an explosion of environmentally-friendly vegetarian foods.
sentences.chinese: 近几年涌现出各式各样的环保素食品。

sentences.english: Great stories still flow but now there are smoothies in the picture.
sentences.chinese: 没有咖啡仍然有好故事涌现，而且图景更加柔顺。

sentences.english: You know, these years, small-and-medium-sized enterprises appear like bamboo shoots after a spring rain.
sentences.chinese: 这些年来，中小企业像雨后春笋般涌现。

definition: to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
lit. after rain, the spring bamboo (idiom); fig. rapid new growth/many new things emerge in rapid succession
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
to collect/to compile/to converge/also written 彙集|汇集[hui4 ji2]
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
